subject: Psychology
title: The Role of Attention
description: One-minute skill: The Role of Attention.

hook.text: You drove the entire route home and can't remember a single turn. Your attention was elsewhere.

buildup.text: Attention is the gateway to memory. If you don't attend to something, it never gets encoded.

discovery.text: The cocktail party effect proves selective attention: you hear your name across a noisy room.

twist.text: Multitasking splits attention and weakens encoding. You remember less of everything, not more.

climax.text: The brain can't encode what it doesn't notice. Attention is the first filter of memory.

punchline.text: No attention, no memory. It's that simple.

quiz.question: Why does multitasking weaken memory formation?
options: It splits attention and weakens encoding
